title: Four-bedroom, three-bathroom house in Bowie, Md., lists for $384,500
text:
The Colonial-style house at 2842 Belair Dr. in Bowie, Md. — listing for $384,500 — has a one-car garage and professionally landscaped yard with a waterfall. (Daniel Rad)

Home buyers looking for a single-family house close to the District can often find more affordable prices in Prince George’s County, Md.

Regionally, the median sales price for a home was $470,000 in July, according to Bright MLS. In Prince George’s, the median sales price was $320,000, up 12.3 percent compared with July 2018. While there are no guarantees that any particular home or neighborhood will appreciate over time, Prince George’s has seen the fastest increases in home values in recent months compared with other counties in the region.

An example of what buyers can find in Prince George’s includes the single-family house at 2842 Belair Dr. in Bowie. Priced at $384,500, this house has four bedrooms and three bathrooms. Annual taxes are $5,215.

[Three-bedroom, four-bathroom house in Bowie, Md., lists for $370,000]

The Colonial-style house has 2,432 square feet, a one-car garage and a professionally landscaped yard with a waterfall, a deck with a retractable awning and several storage sheds.

The traditional floor plan on the main level includes a dining room with built-in bookcases and a bay window, a kitchen with custom-built cabinets, a breakfast area with a beamed ceiling, a family room addition with a beamed ceiling, and skylights. It also has a powder room, a laundry room and a living room with a fireplace.

Tile stairs lead to the upper level, which has four bedrooms and two full bathrooms. Upgrades to the property include an automatic sprinkler system, a whole-house backup generator, a new roof and attic fan and a security system.

Assigned schools include Tulip Grove Elementary, Benjamin Tasker Middle and Bowie High, all rated average or above-average by GreatSchools.org.
